name: Decision Making
description: Decision Making across these episodes focuses on improving the quality of choices under uncertainty—career moves, product bets, leadership calls, and go-to-market decisions—by upgrading inputs, clarifying assumptions, and using repeatable mechanisms. The theme matters because outcomes are noisy (especially in growth and AI), so leaders need processes that produce good decisions consistently, align teams, and avoid common traps like "no decision," overconfidence, and short-term optimization.
subtopics: How to separate decision quality from outcomes and reduce hindsight bias in reviews
How to gather higher-signal input (who to ask, what to ask, and how to avoid vague advice)
How to make decisions in complex systems (growth loops, marketplaces, AI non-determinism) using leading indicators and iterative rollouts
How to run decision-oriented meetings: discovery vs. debate vs. commit, and how to use structured disagreement
How to define strategy and trade-offs clearly (the "why"), then drive alignment and execution through change
How to avoid decision failure modes: "no decision" in buying, analysis paralysis, local optima, and short-term metric gaming
common_frameworks: Working Backwards (start from customer problem/press release, then define requirements and metrics)
Pre-mortems and kill criteria (explicitly define what would make you stop or change course)
Decision hygiene: separate decision quality from outcome; make assumptions explicit; track leading indicators
Disagree-and-commit (surface dissent, decide, then align execution)
Curiosity Loops (systematic, high-signal input gathering via better questions and better advisors)
Discovery vs. decision meetings (clarify the meeting mode to prevent unproductive debate)
Gardener vs. builder mindset (cultivate adaptive systems; use reflection loops to compound judgment)
Step-by-step AI deployment/iteration (tight feedback loops to manage non-determinism and control/agency trade-offs)
Positioning-to-decision narrative (reduce "no decision" by clarifying alternatives and value in a coherent story)
